1. How BMCs and ERPs Relate in Organizations
BMC = Strategic Blueprint

The Business Model Canvas is a high-level framework for articulating how a business creates, delivers, and captures value (Key Partners, Activities, Resources, etc.).
It’s typically used for ideation, strategic planning, and ongoing refinement of the business model.
ERP = Operational Backbone

An Enterprise Resource Planning system is a much more detailed, transaction-focused tool that integrates daily business processes: finance, supply chain, production, HR, and so on.
It serves as the “single source of truth” for data across the organization and helps manage real-time operations (inventory levels, financial transactions, resource usage, etc.).
Aligning BMC & ERP

In an ideal scenario, the BMC sets the strategic direction (“What do we need to do?”) and the ERP system provides the operational data and processes (“How do we actually run and measure it?”).
As a startup grows, it often begins with a simple BMC and lightweight tools (spreadsheets or “baby ERP”)—then over time, invests in more sophisticated systems that mirror the same building blocks in day-to-day operations.

Weekly Snapshot – Quick data checks on sales, costs, resource usage.
Process Tracker – Mapping flows of production/service, identifying waste/bottlenecks.
Improvement Log – Listing problems, solutions, and measured results.
Monthly Review – Summarizing key metrics, improvements, next steps.
